snippet: The derailment sent fireballs ripping through the air, prompting the evacuation of a nearby village and forcing the shut-off of local water supplies.
abstract: Train carrying crude oil derails in southern West Virginia, setting off blasts, igniting conflagration and raising concerns about pollution of city's water supply; some local residents are ordered to evacuate, but no deaths or serious injuries are reported.

byline.original: By DAN HEYMAN and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA
byline.contributor: Dan Heyman reported from Boomer, W. Va., and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York.

lead_paragraph: The derailment sent fireballs ripping through the air, prompting the evacuation of a nearby village and forcing the shut-off of local water supplies.

headline.main: Spilled Oil Keeps Flames Burning After a Train Derailment in West Virginia
headline.print_headline: Spilled Oil Keeps Flames Burning After a Train Derailment in West Virginia
